name: Drug Discount Card
description: Patient Assistance Programs Physicians and patients: There are patient assistance programs that can help patients get medications for free or at a discounted price. Find programs following these steps: Click on the link below. Start typing the brand or generic name in the Drug Search field, click on the drug name that appears, and click the Drug Search button. A list of programs will appear.
fullDescription: Patient Assistance Programs Physicians and patients: There are patient assistance programs that can help patients get medications for free or at a discounted price. Find programs following these steps: Click on the link below. Start typing the brand or generic name in the Drug Search field, click on the drug name that appears, and click the Drug Search button. A list of programs will appear.
whatTheyOffer: The card is good for prescription drugs, over-the-counter medicines and medical supplies if written on a prescription blank, and PET PRESCRIPTIONS medicines purchased at a pharmacy. Youâ€™ll save on most, but not all, prescriptions. - Save up to 80% - Use at over 63,000 pharmacies, including all major U.S. chains - Share the card with friends and family - Use the card as often as needed - Free; no fees or registration - Never expires - EyeCare America Drug Discount Card (PDF)
howToGetIt: Any patient is eligible to use these drug discount cards, regardless of income or insurance status. Print the Drug Discount card to bring to your pharmacy using the link below: https://www.aao.org/Assets/f70d18ce-ef99-4fca-baa8-f95750cd4075/635890710212000000/15848-eca-drugdisccard-onlineflyer-f-pdf?inline=1
